frontmatter.title: UX of a Platform Game
frontmatter.summary: Some years ago I tried building a platformer game (PC / Android) and found the experience interesting from the UX point of view. This is my recap of what I remember. TLDR: You can cheat to make it feel more like a game. Physics simulation rarely makes a good game (at least you'll need to fine tune your character movement physics).

frontmatter.title: Designing to Support (Distributed) Situation Awareness
frontmatter.summary: Situation awareness and distributed situation awareness are interesting concepts, but how does it map to the real world? How can we as designers take the concept and use it to guide our designs, to support rather than hinder the situation awareness of the end users?
